files.description: Documents the catalog directory purpose, required files, and how the case study schema and CLI are used to create and index case studies.
Defines a JSON Schema for catalog metadata and case study records to enable consistent validation and tooling interoperability.
Implements a Python CLI that creates outputs/case_studies/<slug>/case_study.json from inputs, validates it against the schema, and updates outputs/case_studies/index.json atomically.
Provides schema loading and JSON validation helpers used by the CLI to validate case study documents against METADATA_SCHEMA.json.
Contains functions to read, update, sort, and write the case study index.json in a safe and deterministic manner.
Centralizes filesystem path resolution for outputs/catalog and outputs/case_studies to keep CLI behavior consistent across environments.
Provides a minimal, valid case study JSON template used by the CLI as the starting structure when creating new case studies.

missionDescription: Create /outputs/catalog/ with METADATA_SCHEMA.json (or JSON Schema), plus a small add_case_study.py CLI that writes a new /outputs/case_studies/<slug>/case_study.json and updates an index file (e.g., /outputs/case_studies/index.json).
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Establishes a machine-readable case-study catalog (schema + CLI) so future research inputs (case studies, exemplars, citations, rights metadata) can be added consistently and programmatically, enablin...
projectName: /outputs/catalog/ with METADATA_SCHEMA.json (or JSON Schema), plus a small add_case_study.py CLI that writes a new /outputs/case_studies/<slug>/case_study.json and updates an index file (e.g., /outputs/case_studies/index.json).
